qas.question: Vocal music in the Renaissance is noted for an increasingly elaborate what?
What liturgical form besides motets endured throughout the entire Renaissance period?
Monody, the madrigal comedy, and intermedio are all precursors to what?

context: Vocal music in the Renaissance is noted for the flourishing of an increasingly elaborate <a0_0>polyphonic style<a0_0/>. The principal liturgical forms which endured throughout the entire Renaissance period were <a1_0>masses<a1_0/> and motets, with some other developments towards the end, especially as composers of sacred music began to adopt secular forms (such as the madrigal) for their own designs. Towards the end of the period, the early dramatic precursors of <a2_0>opera<a2_0/> such as monody, the madrigal comedy, and the intermedio are seen.
